Abstract: This study examines the application of best practices in sensory analysis and consumer preference assessment, focusing on descriptive analysis and consumer tests. A comprehensive review of existing literature reveals the importance of standardized methods and rigorous data collection procedures in sensory evaluation. The findings highlight the need for trained assessors, controlled environments, and replicable protocols to ensure accurate and reliable results. By integrating these best practices, sensory analysis can provide actionable insights for product development and marketing strategies, ultimately informing consumer preferences and driving business success.
